abstracts.cdata!:
This report is an environmental
            assessment of the Qinba Mountains Poverty Reduction Project.
            The project will reduce overall poverty in the Qinba area
            through: labor mobility; rural infrastructure; land and
            farmer development; township and village enterprise
            development; micro-finance; and institution building and
            poverty monitoring. Main environmental impacts followed by
            mitigation measures are: a) land occupation, destruction of
            local vegetation and soil erosion- lessened by site
            location; b) waste residue - used as feed stuff where
            possible; c) dust pollution - closed production wherever
            possible; d) noise pollution; - refrain from explosions at
            night; e) waste water increase - handled by settling basin
            and other equipment; f) waste gas production - mitigated by
            site placement; and g) some effect on local sanitation and
            epidemic prevention - mitigated by burying organic garbage.
